newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Keast-1 well to go deeper - Woodside.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Keast-1 well to go deeper - Woodside.

text.p: Woodside Petroleum Ltd said on Tuesday that the planned total depth of the Keast-1 exploration well offshore Western Australia has been revised to 3,850 metres from 3,620 metres.
After reaching total depth and upon completion of a further logging programme, a production test will be made of the previously reported upper gas interval, Woodside said.
Last week Woodside said logging confirmed the presence of 76 metres of gross gas column in three separate reservoirs.
The well, in permit WA-6L, was at a depth of 3,720 metres and drilling ahead on Tuesday.
WA-6-L is on Australia's North West Shelf.

Equal partners in the North West Shelf project are units of The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd, The British Petroleum Co Plc, Japan Australia LNG (MiMi) Pty Ltd, a partnership of Mitsui & Co Ltd and Mitsubishi Corp, Chevron Corp, Royal Dutch/Shell Group and Woodside.
Woodside shares closed 12 cents lower at A$9.30 on Tuesday.
